Contradict fact: The claim that no Americans have died from the flu in 2020 contradicts the fact that thousands of Americans have died from influenza during the pandemic.
Understate: The claim understates the number of flu deaths by stating that no Americans have died from the flu this year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the assertion that no Americans have died from the flu in 2020.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the information being provided by the CDC and other sources is false or misleading without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that the data on flu deaths may be affected by the way people are seeking healthcare during the COVID-19 pandemic, as stated by the CDC.
